original: “Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā—
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā
translated: “Though, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘pubbe vāhaṁ manussabhūto samāno sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko ahosin’ti.
analyzed: pubbe vā aham manussa bhūtaḥ samānaḥ sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ ahosin ti
translated: ‘Formerly, when I was a human being, I was of a kind not to harm living beings,’

original: Puna ca bhaṇitaṁ—
analyzed: punar ca bhaṇita
translated: and this also was said:

original: ‘lomasakassapo nāma isi samāno anekasate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajī’ti.
analyzed: lomasakassapaḥ nāma isi samānaḥ aneka sate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyam mahāyaññam yaji iti
translated: ‘The seer called Lomasakassapa, after killing many hundreds of living beings, performed the great sacrifice of the horse.’

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, bhagavatā bhaṇitaṁ—🔽‘pubbe vāhaṁ manussabhūto samāno sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko ahosin’ti, tena hi ‘lomasakassapena🔽isinā anekasate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajitan’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena bhagavatā bhaṇita  pubbe vā aham manussa bhūtaḥ samānaḥ sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ ahosin ti tena hi lomasakassapena  isinā aneka sate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyam mahā yaññam yam tam micchā
translated: If the first statement was true, then the second statement must be false,🔽and if the second statement was true, then the first statement must be false.

original: Yadi ‘lomasakassapena isinā anekasate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajitaṁ’,
analyzed: yadi lomasakassapena isinā aneka sate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyam mahā yaññam yajita
translated: If the seer Lomasakassapa, after killing many hundreds of living beings, performed the great sacrifice of the horse,

original: tena hi ‘pubbe vāhaṁ manussabhūto samāno sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko ahosin’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: tena hi pubbe vā aham manussa bhūtaḥ samānaḥ sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ ahosin ti tat pi vacanam micchā
translated: then the statement that ‘formerly, when I was a human being, I was of a kind not to harm living beings’ must be false.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This double-pronged question has come up. You must solve it.”

original: “Bhāsitampetaṁ, mahārāja, bhagavatā—
analyzed: mahā rāja bhagavatā
translated: “Great king, this was said by the Blessed One:

original: ‘pubbe vāhaṁ manussabhūto samāno sattānaṁ aviheṭhakajātiko ahosin’ti, ‘lomasakassapena
analyzed: pubbe vā aham manussa bhūtaḥ samānaḥ sattānam a viheṭhaka jātikaḥ ahosinti lomasakassapena
translated: ‘In the past, when I was a human being, I was not of a kind to harm living beings.’ And it was said by the sage Lomasakassapa:

original: isinā anekasate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyaṁ mahāyaññaṁ yajitaṁ’, tañca pana rāgavasena
analyzed: isinā aneka sate pāṇe ghātayitvā vājapeyyam mahā yaññam yajita tat ca pana rāga vasena
translated: ‘Having killed many hundreds of living beings, he performed the great sacrifice of the horse.’ But that was done by one who was devoid of consciousness,

original: visaññinā, no sacetanenā”ti.
analyzed: visaññinā no sa cetanena ati
translated: not by one who was conscious, and it was done out of passion.”

original: “Aṭṭhime, bhante nāgasena, puggalā pāṇaṁ hananti.
analyzed: aṭṭhime bhante nāgasena puggalā pāṇam hananti
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, there are eight kinds of people who kill living beings.

original: Katame aṭṭha?🔽Ratto rāgavasena pāṇaṁ hanati, duṭṭho dosavasena pāṇaṁ hanati, mūḷho mohavasena pāṇaṁ🔽hanati, mānī mānavasena pāṇaṁ hanati, luddho lobhavasena pāṇaṁ hanati, akiñcano jīvikatthāya
analyzed: katame aṭṭha  rattaḥ rāga vasena pāṇam hanati duṭṭhaḥ dosa vasena pāṇam hanati mūḷhaḥ moha vasena pāṇa  hanati mānī māna vasena pāṇam hanati luddhaḥ lobha vasena pāṇam hanati akiñcanaḥ jīvikatthāya
translated: What are the eight?

original: pāṇaṁ hanati, bālo hassavasena pāṇaṁ hanati, rājā vinayanavasena pāṇaṁ hanati.
analyzed: pāṇam hanati bālaḥ hassa vasena pāṇam hanati rājā vinayana vasena pāṇam hanati
translated: One who is passionate kills living beings out of passion; one who is malicious kills living beings out of malice; one who is confused kills living beings out of confusion; one who is proud kills living beings out of pride; one who is greedy kills living beings out of greed; one who is poor kills living beings for the sake of his livelihood; one who is foolish kills living beings out of laughter; a king kills living beings out of the law.

original: Ime kho, bhante nāgasena, aṭṭha puggalā pāṇaṁ hananti.
analyzed: ime kho bhante nāgasena aṭṭha puggalā pāṇam hananti
translated: These are the eight kinds of people who kill living beings.

original: Pākatikaṁyeva, bhante nāgasena, bodhisattena katan”ti.
analyzed: pākatikayā iva bhante nāgasena bodhisattena katanti
translated: “It was done naturally, revered Nāgasena.”

original: “Na, mahārāja, pākatikaṁ bodhisattena kataṁ, yadi, mahārāja, bodhisatto pakatibhāvena onameyya mahāyaññaṁ yajituṁ, na yimaṁ gāthaṁ bhaṇeyya—🔽‘Sasamuddapariyāyaṁ,
analyzed: na mahā rāja pākatikam bodhisattena yadi mahā rāja bodhisatto pakati bhāvena onameyya mahā yaññam na gātham bhaṇeyya  sa samudda pariyāya
translated: “No, sire, it was not done naturally. If the Bodhisatta had naturally inclined to offer the great sacrifice, he would not have spoken this verse:🔽‘The earth with its ocean’s shore,

original: mahiṁ sāgarakuṇḍalaṁ;
analyzed: mahim sāgara kuṇḍala
translated: The earth with its ocean’s rim,

original: Na icche saha nindāya,
analyzed: na icche saha nindāya
translated: I do not wish with censure,

original: evaṁ seyha vijānahī’ti.
analyzed: evam seyha vijānahi iti
translated: So know this to be the best.’

original: Evaṁvādī, mahārāja, bodhisatto saha dassanena candavatiyā rājakaññāya visaññī ahosi🔽khittacitto ratto visaññibhūto ākulākulo turitaturito tena vikkhittabhantaluḷitacittena

translated: When he had spoken thus, sire, the Bodhisatta became indifferent to the royal maiden Candāvatī as soon as he saw her.

original: gaṇhāti, mattampi hatthiṁ upeti, samuddampi atīradassiṁ pakkhandati, candanikampi
